record.darwin:Remarks: The original label in the jar stated that these were UNC-IMS 6332 but the catalog book listed UNC-IMS 6332 as Anguilla rostrata. The catalog book was searched for a catalog number that listed the same species and number of specimens but none was found so assumption was made that this number was used twice. UNC-IMS 6331 & 6332 originally contained lots from multiple localities. These lots were split into multiple NCSM #s to conform to collection curation and data entry standards. This lot contains specimens from both UNIC-IMS 6331 & 6332 because they were split at some point originally (at IMS).

record.darwin:Remarks: Lower jaw teeth in multiple rows, upper simple; seems to key to Oxyurichthys in Larson and Murdy (FAO, 2001). Dorsal fin=VI-I,12 anal fin=I,13; no dermal projection on eye; predorsal crest not apparent; lateral scales missing in part but may = ca.45-49 - Wayne C. Starnes, 2006. This was later determined to be O. microlepis by Frank L. Pezold.
